    • GardenEditor

      public GardenEditor()

  • Method Details

    • setSelectedPlant

      public static void setSelectedPlant​(java.lang.String plantName, Point pos)
      Set the currentlySelectedPlant for while dragging a plant from the plant list to a plot
      Parameters:
      plantName - the name of the plant to select from the garden
      pos - the current position of the plant in the garden

    • setSelectedPlant

      public static void setSelectedPlant​(Plant p)
      Set the currentlySelectedPlant for while dragging a plant from the plant list to a plot
      Parameters:
      plant - the plant to select

    • getSelectedPlant

      public static Plant getSelectedPlant()
      Gets the currently selected plant
      Returns:
      the plant object representing the image that is currently being dragged

    • transformPlots

      public static double transformPlots​(java.util.ArrayList<Plot> plots, double canvasWidth, double canvasHeight, double ppf)
      Transform a plot to fit in the desired canvas. Transform includes scaling a plot up and smoothing the edges of a rough shape
      Parameters:
      plots - an array list of plots that are in the garden
      canvasWidth - the width of the canvas to scale to
      canvasHeight - the height of the canvas to scale to
      ppf - is the current scale of the garden, current pixels per foot
      Returns:
      pixels per foot, a value representing the resulting scale of the garden

    • calculatePlotBoundaries

      public static void calculatePlotBoundaries​(java.util.ArrayList<Plot> plots)
      Calculate the boundaries of the plots in your garden. Finds the leftmost, rightmost, topmost, and bottom most coordinate in the garden.
      Parameters:
      plots - a list of plots in the garden

    • calculateScale

      public static double calculateScale()
      Calculate the scale factor that is needed to fit the garden in the desired canvas
      Returns:
      scale factor as a double

    • scalePlots

      private static void scalePlots​(java.util.ArrayList<Plot> plots)
      Resize all plots in the garden according to the scale factor. New position = (old position - center) * scale + center
      Parameters:
      plots - all the plots in the garden

    • recenterGarden

      private static void recenterGarden​(java.util.ArrayList<Plot> plots)
      Recenter all of the plots in the garden after the scale has been applied
      Parameters:
      plots - a list of all the plots in the garden

    • inPlot

      public static int inPlot​(Point pos, java.util.ArrayList<Plot> plots, double verticalBuffer, double horizontalBuffer)
      Check if the point falls within any of the plots in the garden
      Parameters:
      pos - coordinate of the point to check
      plots - all the plots in the garden
      verticalBuffer - buffer value for y coord
      horizontalBuffer - buffer value for x coord
      Returns:
      the plot number that this coordinate belongs to,, -1 if none

    • inBounds

      private static boolean inBounds​(java.util.ArrayList<Point> points, double x, double y)
      Checks if a coordinate is within the bounds of a list of points
      Parameters:
      points - the list points that is used as bounds
      x - the x coordinate of the position to check
      y - the y coordinate of the position to check
      Returns:
      true or false if the coordinate is within the bounds

    • getControlPoints

      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Point>> getControlPoints​(java.util.ArrayList<Point> coords, double alpha)
      Creates a pair of control points for each coordinate in the list The control points list is used in the bezier algorithm to smooth plot edges
      Parameters:
      coords - an array list of points used as a reference for the control points
      alpha - a numeric value between zero and 1 used as a factor to generate control points
      Returns:
      the list of lists (list of control point pairs)

    • cubicBezier

      private static java.util.ArrayList<Point> cubicBezier​(Point start, Point end, Point ctrl1, Point ctrl2, int nv)
      Calculates a list of coordinates following a Bezier curve between a start point and end point
      Parameters:
      start - the start position
      end - the end position
      ctrl1 - the first control point
      ctrl2 - the second control point
      nv - the number of verticies to add between start and end point (including the start and end point)
      Returns:
      list of coordinates along the Bezier curve

    • smooth

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Point> smooth​(java.util.ArrayList<Point> points, double alpha, int pointsPerSegment)
      Creates a new list of coordinates with a smooth exterior following a bezier curve of the original coordinates NOTE: This algorithm and the 2 private helper methods above were based on another project http://lastresortsoftware.blogspot.com/2010/12/smooth-as.html
      Parameters:
      coords - an array list of points that need smoothing
      alpha - a numeric value between zero and 1 for the tightness of fit
      pointsPerSegment - number of verticies to add between every coordinate
      Returns:
      a list of points for a newly smoothed plot
